abstract: Why stop at $39 billion? The Blackstone Group set a record for leveraged buyouts with its deal for Equity Office Properties Trust last week, driving investment bankers mad with the idea that an even bigger whale of a buyout is swimming out there. And in this private equity boom, giants once thought of as unthinkable buyout candidates — Home Depot, Yahoo — have been floated as possible targets.

abstract: He may have been autocratic and very well compensated, but former Home Depot chief executive Robert Nardelli may also have been onto something. That is the suggestion that a few analysts are making as they evaluate the recent decision by Mr. Nardelli’s successor, Frank Blake, to consider selling Home Depot’s contractor-supply business. Building that business was a pet project of Mr. Nardelli, who was convinced that the consumer remodeling market was reaching maturity. He pinned his strategy — and much of the company’s capital — on HD Supply, the Home Depot division that serves commercial customers.
